content.description: Traverse in for the right or jump for the start holds, then climb the thin seam on the south side of the wall.
content.location: 10 feet to the right of barf crack is a small seam.

content.description:
This route is pretty dangerous if supplemental gear isn't used.  The first bolt is 30ft up.  It's really safe if you protect with gear.

Climb up the upward right diagonal rock. Protection can be placed here if anxious.  Arrive at a comfy ledge.  The first bolt is still 12ft up at this point.  Thus while on comfy ledge protect with gear in the vertical and horizontal cracks to prevent a broken tibia.  Pull artsy and delicate sequences to each bolt and enjoy.
content.protection: 3 bolts plus Small gear.  Bring some small nuts and a set of C3's.
content.location: Left of Barf Crack.  Look for 3 bolts on the upper half of the rock.

climbs.name: Barf Crack
climbs.fa: Reid Dowdle, Dave Bingham, Chris Filer

content.description:
The first route put up on the wall that ascends the obvious wide hands corner in the center of the face.

As said in Dave Bingham's guidebook, "A rather strenuous effort" this route definitely packs a punch.

A tricky start from the right leads to the base of this off hands corner. Hand jam/chimney/stem your way up the crack on solid pro to the top.
content.protection: This is a traditional route so there isn't a bolted anchor and the gear goes up to wide hand sized pieces.
content.location: This is located in the center of the wall and the most obvious line.
